title: Boost Mobile AUSX Open Supercross
articleDescription: The world’s best Supercross athletes’ storm into Marvel Stadium on Saturday 22 November
articleContent:
The world’s best Supercross athletes’ storm into Melbourne for the most electrifying night of supercross action. Marvel Stadium becomes the battleground as Australia’s biggest Supercross event, the AUSX Open, returns for high-speed, bar-to-bar chaos. Expect international talent and non-stop entertainment.

Event commences: 6:00pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey. 

If you use Journey Planner within 14 days of this event, you'll see all the extra services we've added to help you get there.

Metropolitan train

Additional services for the following lines arrive before the concert:

  • Mernda, Greensborough, Sandringham, Craigieburn

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Mernda, Greensborough, Flinders Street, Newport, Craigieburn and Upfield

Ringwood Group passengers are advised to alight on Clifton Hill Group services from Southern Cross (Platform 9), then change at Parliament for a bus.

Glen Waverley passengers are advised to alight on Clifton Hill Group services from Southern Cross (Platform 9), then change at Parliament for a bus.

Dandenong Group & Frankston passengers are advised to alight on Sandringham services from Southern Cross (Platforms 13), then change at South Yarra for a bus to Caulfield.

Werribee Passengers are advised to alight on Newport services from Southern Cross (Platform 14), then change at Newport for a bus.

Sunbury Passengers are advised to board any available Northern Group service from Southern Cross (Platform 11), then change at North Melbourne for a bus.

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Extra trams will operate as Route 30a via La Trobe Street, and as Route 86a via Bourke Street. 

Take advantage of the city’s Free Tram Zone which extends from Queen Victoria Market to Docklands, Spring Street, Flinders Street Station and Federation Square.

Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Customers can catch the following bus routes close to Marvel Stadium:

  • Route 232 (Altona North to City)
  • Route 235 (Fishermans Bend to City)
  • Route 302 (Box Hill to City)
  • Route 304 (Doncaster SC to City)
  • Route 905 (The Pines SC to City)
  • Route 906 (Warrandyte to City)
  • Route 907 (Mitcham to City)

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the show.

Regional train

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Waurn Ponds, Ballarat, Ballarat & Bendigo

Return coaches due to rail replacement for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Seymour Line

Additional information

  • Download our free mobile apps for Android and iOS to get public transport information on the go. You can also top up your myki instantly in the app.
  • If you need accessibility information and assistance, see Accessibility.
  • Top up your myki before travelling or set Auto Top Up so you never need to top up again. For more information, see Auto Top Up.
  • Mobile myki is a new way to travel with myki. It’s a digital myki on your Android phone on the Google Wallet™ app.
  • For information about tickets for children and concessions, see Children and Concessions.
  • If you need more information or special assistance, please call 1800 800 007 before travelling.
